poem:
Title: Burst of Arias

Siegfried, bear-clad voyager,
Adorned in midnight garb, bounds 
Through symphony's fault line.
Breath, unbetrayed, scarce yet unfettered -
A steadfast sentinel in his echoing aria.

Slippery Mime, coiffured green, 
A wool-knitted spectre,
Awaits in expectant welcome.

Wotan-Wanderer observes, 
Godly and aloof.
Each note, an orchestral fruit, plucked and pecked,
In this theatre of vivacious Valkyries.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The week in classical: Siegfried; The Handmaid’s Tale; Tosca – review As if released from starting blocks, Siegfried, hero of Wagner’s Ring, in black hoodie with teddy bear under his arm, hurtles through the audience at top speed and leaps on stage for his first vocal entry, impressively still in control of his breath. Mime, his slippery Nibelung keeper – green hair, woollen pixie hat – is ready to greet him. Then the god Wotan-Wanderer". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The week in classical: Siegfried; The Handmaid’s Tale; Tosca – review As if released from starting blocks, Siegfried, hero of Wagner’s Ring, in black hoodie with teddy bear under his arm, hurtles through the audience at top speed and leaps on stage for his first vocal entry, impressively still in control of his breath. Mime, his slippery Nibelung keeper – green hair, woollen pixie hat – is ready to greet him. Then the god Wotan-Wanderer
